ARABIC: وَمَا هَٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَآ إِلَّا لَهْوٌ وَلَعِبٌ وَإِنَّ ٱلدَّارَ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ لَهِىَ ٱلْحَيَوَانُ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The life of this world is nothing but a game and a diversion. The abode of the Next World - that is truly Life if they only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The life of this world is only a sport and play. It is surely the home of the Hereafter that will indeed be life extended and new, if only they knew!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The present life is nothing but sport and amusement. The true life is in the Abode of the Hereafter; if only they knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The worldly life is not more than a childish game. It is the life hereafter which will be the real life, if only they knew it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And this worldly life is nothing but pastime and game; indeed the abode of the Hereafter – that is indeed the true life; if only they knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And this life of the world is only an amusement and a play! Verily, the home of the Hereafter -- that is the life indeed, if they but knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And this life of the world is nothing but a sport and a play; and as for the next abode, that most surely is the life-- did they but know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: This present life is naught but a diversion and a sport; surely the Last Abode is Life, did they but know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: This life of the world is but a pastime and a game. Lo! the home of the Hereafter - that is Life, if they but knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The life of this world is nothing but sport and a diversion. It is the life of the Hereafter which is the only true life, if they but knew it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And this life of the world is but: sport and play. Verily the home of the Hereafter--that is life indeed, if they but knew!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The life of this world is nothing but diversion and play, but the abode of the Hereafter is indeed Life (itself), had they known!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: What is the life of this world but amusement and play? but verily the Home in the Hereafter,- that is life indeed, if they but knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And this life of the world is only amusement and play! Verily, the home of the Hereafter, that is the life indeed (i.e. the eternal life that will never end), if they but knew
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The life of this world is nothing but a diversion and play. Indeed, the Everlasting Residence is the Eternal Life, if they but knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The life of this world is nothing but diversion and play, and the Home of the Hereafter is the Life, if they only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement. And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life, if only they knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [29:64] And the life of this world is nothing but diversion and play, whereas closeness [to God] pertains to concern for the Hereafter, since the fruits thereof will be revealed in it. But surely the Abode of the Hereafter is indeed the [true] Life, if they only knew, this, [then] they would not prefer this world to it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (This life of the world) the comfort and embellishment which is the life of the world (is but a pastime) exhilaration (and a game) and falsehood which does not last. (Lo! the home of the Hereafter) i.e. Paradise (that is Life) wherein its inhabitant never die, (if they but knew) if they but believed, but they do not know this nor believe in it.
